unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Two-Proportion Z-Interval: Conditions
question_text: A high school athletic director was interested whether high school males are more likely to compete in sports than high school females are. He randomly sampled $200$ high school males across the country and found that $82$ of them participated in at least one high school sport at some point during the year. This compares to $68$ out of $200$ randomly sampled high school females who participated in at least one sport during the year. Suppose the athletic director wanted to perform a two-proportion $Z$ -interval. In addition to needing two independent random samples, another necessary condition is

choices.text: Sample sizes must be large, say at least 30 30 each.
Combined sample sizes must be large, say at least 30 30 .
The parent population must be roughly normal.
